thread.title: Five days of lane closures and delays at the I-22 interchange construction site
thread.title_full: Five days of lane closures and delays at the I-22 interchange construction site | AL.com

author: Joe Songer | jsonger@al.com
title: Five days of lane closures and delays at the I-22 interchange construction site
text:
From Monday night through Friday morning, lane closures and delays will take place on I-65 at the construction site of the I-22 interchange.
ALDOT announced these lane closures:
Monday, July 20 a t 9 p.m. thru Tuesday, July 21 at 6 a.m. there will be lane closures on I-65 northbound and southbound between Finley Blvd. (milepost 262B) and Walkers Chapel Road (milepost 267) to pour Bridge Decks.
Thursday, July 23 at 9 p.m. thru Friday, July 24 at 6 a.m. there will be lane closures on I-65 southbound between Finley Blvd. (milepost 262B) and Walkers Chapel Road (milepost 267) to pour Bridge Decks.
Two Alabama state troopers will be at the construction site all week to help with traffic control.
Paving is underway on the last section of I-22 between Coalburg Road and interchange at I-65.
More construction is occurring north of the interchange at the Hwy. 31 exit at Fultondale.
Construction began on the network of 14 ramps and bridges that will link the two interstates in 2010. The contractor, Archer Western, is on a $2,000 daily penalty to complete the behind-schedule interchange project by August.
A reduced speed limit of 45 mph is in effect throughout the work zone. Motorists are asked to observe work zone speed limits and other work zone signs, and use extreme caution in this area.
I-22, when completed, is an Interstate Highway that will follow the U.S. 78 corridor (Corridor X) on a 213-mile-long route from Memphis, Tennessee, to Birmingham, Alabama.
 I-22 will be part of an interstate highway system that will connect downtown Atlanta with Birmingham, Memphis, Little Rock, and Oklahoma City.
Here are links to I-22 construction galleries from the past to show progress:
